author: ebuckle
title: COP27 Elevating African Leadership
description: COP27 is not inclusive enough resulting in blind decision-making. Cardano does not have a presence at this global event and Africa is the new frontier of blockchain combined with climate solutions.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposer has provided a description of the issue in their Problem Statement but it could be more concise. The main issue to tackle here is the lack of inclusiveness at COP27 resulting in blind decision-making. The second issue is Cardano not being present at the event that is the solution to the 1st issue.

I am not convinced that the problem statement defines a problem within the challenge when trying to answer wether the SCC does prepare Africa for a future of wide-scale Cardano adoption? This being said, it does fit within offering solutions to infrastructure and education concerns.

The proposal would lead to a positive impact on the Cardano/Catalyst ecosystem in terms of awareness however it doesn't seem to have a direct practical impact for the Cardano ecosystem. The proposal doesn't clearly articulates how it will add value to the Cardano/Catalyst ecosystem beyond the fact that blockchain and Cardano will be discussed at the event. The direct results/consequences for Cardano are difficult to quantify, I will therefore rate IMPACT a 3/5.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer gave a good account of what experience will be necessary to deliver on the proposal and provided a description of who the team members are, including their roles and some past work. 
The budget is outlined clearly, understandable and broken down into identifiable items (Community-building long-run effort, Summit team preparation, Summit coverage with IT support and facilitation, Feedback, monitoring impact, and reporting, financial management). The budget makes sense and seems reasonable to achieve the set goals.
The proposer provided a list of actionable tasks and order of execution, and a clear timeline for the project ( 6 months breakdown from June to end of year). Given the experience and plan presented, it is very likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal provided a roadmap with milestones and a time horizon for achievement, as well as KPIs for the success for the event (1000 participants globally, 154 million people reached). I will argue that the KPIs are valid for the event, but lack of Cardano-specific KPIs (number of Cardano partnerships, number of Cardano/Catalyst attendants, number of Cardano speak time or events, and Cardano adoption in future innovations or solutions). Given the KPIs and nature of this proposal, the community should be able to easily track the progress of this proposal. I would rate AUDITABILITY a 3 out of 5.

f6_assessments.q0: We realize that the event aims to transmit knowledge about blockchain during a lecture cycle, emphasizing how technology and Cardano can contribute to the evolution of the African continent. Thus, we have that the proposal is aligned with the objectives of the challenge, in the same way that its success would help in the resolution of local problems, so there is the possibility of a positive impact in the medium, long and long term. However, given the duration of the event (24 hours), it seems that the budget being requested is very high. Possibly a more lasting impact would be achieved if this amount were allocated to lectures spread over more days so that the engagement lasts longer. Even as the material gets recorded, the event seems too momentary for longer-term relationships to form, which seems to be the most important point here.
f6_assessments.q1: Regarding the ways chosen for the project to be executed, we found a good action plan, with consistent and well-organized activities, which evolve gradually. We say this because in the timeline we find steps that range from the organization and establishment of initial partnerships, to the execution of the event itself and the subsequent data collection. About the professionals involved and who will carry out these steps, we can see that they have considerable familiarity with the subject, having experience in social causes involved with other developing nations. In addition, their CVs were made available so that their experiences could be proven. However, once again it seems to us that the problem is mainly in relation to the budget being requested. In the breakdown of the budget, we can find, for example, that the largest allocation of capital ($11,000, approximately 38% of the total) is going to the long-term effort to create the community. But this doesn't seem very consistent with the daily scope of the event and we're not very confident in saying that these relationships will last (after the event) in order to justify the allocation. In general, we can think like this in relation to the general expenses with the event.
f6_assessments.q2: Regarding the ways chosen to track progress, we note that relevant indicators were chosen, especially when measuring the local impact, the partnerships formed and the number of participants. These parameters make it easier for us to understand whether the desired connections are actually being formed. Although the exposure of the results to the public was mentioned, we miss the indication of how this transmission will be done, which would be the tool used for this. Furthermore, regarding the perception of the project's success, it seems very important that some goals had been established that would make it easier for us to understand whether the event was successful or not. These goals could be, for example, a number of new projects that emerged from the knowledge acquired during the event.

f6_assessments.q0: Africa is the second most populous and second largest continent in the world. The African economy encompasses the continent's trade, industry, agriculture, and human resources. About 1.3 billion people (as of 2019) live in 54 different countries in Africa. Africa is a continent rich in resources. It has a hot and dry climate. However, COP27 (United Nations Climate Change Summit) is not comprehensive enough to lead to blind decision-making. and Cardano were not present at this global event. Besides, Africa is the new frontier of blockchain combined with climate solutions. Proposal addresses the challenge posed. Ecosystem is not only to promote technological leap but also to establish other positive impacts with this planet, such as: environment, climate, ... all for the benefit of people. People. people, communities, developed societies and developed ecosystems. I think the proposal was detailed and richly described. The focus of the event is on addressing climate finance and agriculture in Africa, becoming a platform for transparency, cooperation and support, and gathering communities for diverse, positive climate solutions. . It is very positive that the author of the proposal has set several KPIs right from the beginning of the impact analysis of the proposal. It proves that the author has precise goals, knows what he will do, how to achieve the ultimate goal is the success of the project. Besides, the author of the proposal also recognizes the possible risks. At the same time, there are solutions to reduce risks when the proposal is implemented. Enhance project success.
f6_assessments.q1: The feasibility of the proposal is fine. We know the members are people with the right qualifications and experience to perform the tasks on the project. As suggested. Antoinette Vermilye: Co-Founder of SHE Climate Change and the Gallifrey Foundation and International Gender Champion; Bianca Pitt: Co-Founder of SHE Climate Change and Founder of Environmental Women's Network; Elise Course: Co-Founder of SHE Changes Climate and Chair of Climate & Sustainability... At the same time, the author also provided text presentations about each member, and attached a link to let us know more about the calendar. history, experience of the members that the proposal presented. Regarding the plan of the proposal, the author provides us with background information to evaluate this section. The first is about the route. The proponent cites the goals to be achieved in 6 months. To build relationships and execute strategies to help mentor sustainable growth. There is a problem here, the author provides information that planning for 6 months. However, the analysis is presented from June to December of January. So how long will the project be implemented and completed? The roadmap in each month is still presented by the author very specifically for each work to be done. We know what work will be done to get to the end result of the project. Finally on the budget, the Proposal asks for a budget of $29.000. With the following objectives: Efforts to build long-term community; Preparing the team for the summit, and some other work... is explained in detail about each budget for each task to be performed in the project. In my opinion, the required budget is consistent with the project roadmap and is reasonably explained. In general, the proposal has a very good plan, detailed roadmap, transparent budget and experienced team, increasing the viability for the success of the project.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal is new, but from the plan board, it shows the expertise and active efforts of the proposed team. The detailed roadmap in each milestone can help the developer easily audit the successful progress of the project. Besides, the strong team and transparent detailed budget in the proposal strengthen the confidence in the success of the project. Proposal authors provide us with Deliverables and a variety of Key Indicators, making it easy for us to measure the successful progress of a project. About the final product is the success of the project, which is the goal of this proposal. The focus of the event is on addressing climate finance and agriculture in Africa. In my opinion, the information provided is sufficient and clear, facilitating the audit in a transparent manner.

f6_assessments.q0: The overall idea is that this proposers organization SHE wants to host an event during another high-profile event in hopes of leveraging the clout of the COP27 to lobby for more Africa-based inclusion in the climate change conversation. This is my perception of what this proposal is seeking to achieve. There are some unclear aspects that will be addressed yet this is the gist of my understanding of the funding request. To some degree, I can see that this proposal addresses the challenge but there are some uncertainties.
f6_assessments.q1: I can agree based on the given information that this proposal can be implemented successfully but I do not see with full clarity how this proposal intends to add value to the Cardano ecosystem. I lack coherent details and specifics of how this will serve as a gateway to expansion. I recognize that COP27 reached 154 million people according to the proposal but it is not clear how the SHE event can leverage that traffic for its own benefit and leverage it for the future benefit of Cardano in Africa. I respect the aforementioned outcomes are "intended" I just lack the more concrete details of how.
f6_assessments.q2: The deliverables and Key Metrics are quite vague which for the nature of this type of proposal isn't entirely a problem. I suggest that this proposal is reworked to more clearly define how to integrate and position Cardano into your larger vision. For example, "expecting" big interest in Cardano at the event isn't the same thing as stating a clear set of actions that within reason could result in their being a "big interest in Cardano" with a plan to then leverage and convert that interest into tangible value for your organization and Cardano.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal presents a clear and concise description of the problem it intends to address. In addition, the author made an excellent correlation between the problems that the challenge indicates as a need for a solution and how her proposal helps in some relevant points.

Something relevant highlighted by the author was to clarify how the Cardano community in Africa will be highlighted in relation to the other global themes that are the focus of the event. She clearly presented a strategy that has the potential to generate value for the community.

An improvement worth considering would be to exemplify how initiatives similar to this one have previously generated scalable results. This would add value to the proposal by making successful cases tangible and would certainly increase the impact of the solution.
f6_assessments.q1:
Regarding the competence of the team in developing the project, there is no doubt that favorable conditions exist, given that the authors are the founders of the event in question.

An improvement to consider would be to appoint a focal team that will be focused on developing the interests of the Cardano community throughout the event's program.

Just as the roadmap and required skills were presented with exemplary clarity, we could also see who is responsible for developing the community themes during the event, as the event founders will have a number of other commitments and will probably not be the team responsible for the event. operationalize the proposal.

Finally, the risks indicated are quite realistic and coherent. Strong indication that the author has experience in this field and is prepared to deal with adversities.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal clearly contains what milestones it intends to achieve, how it can be monitored and what indicators of success we can expect.

This presentation indicates the level of transparency and visibility that we can expect in project implementation. Good point for the author.

Just to improve the proposal, it would be interesting to see additional links to the tools used to track the progress of the project. We received attachments with the content of the event, but we could also see more information directly related to the purpose of the proposal.

solution: Global online event during COP27 to network diverse leaders, including Cardano to unlock climate solutions and build practical innovations that tackle challenges that Africa and Global South face.
experience: 30+ years of experience in climate and sustainability, building global networks, foundations, and environmental conservation. The last two years of SCC have reached 154 million impressions and political traction with the COP27 Presidency.
